title: What is your dream of life? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have a nice, large, clean house, with preferably at least 1 or 2 extra bedrooms than there are people living in the house (for the sake of having space for visitors). I live in a two-story house with a basement. The house is well-furnished; there are railings alongside the stairs and any balconies above the first floor with too little space between bars for any little children (whether mine or a visitor’s) to squeeze through. The Master Bedroom is big, with a nice big king-size bed, and there are two walk-in closets and a nice big bathroom connected to it with a large shower room, with a sort of built-in bench of some kind to sit down while showering. There is also a nice, big bath tub, maybe with those hot tub/jet fixings, which is bubble-bath friendly (because I’d love to spoil myself sometimes. Note: I would not try bubble bath and jets at the same time, as that is likely a recipe for disaster). There are enough rooms for a full family with any (if any?) children being able to have their own room. There are at least 3 bathrooms, so fighting over bathrooms is down to a minimum… The house could probably be cabin-ish, with a lot of wood and maybe a fancy-looking fireplace, but still with modern fixings and such, like a super nice kitchen and nice modern-looking colors splashed in appropriate rooms. But most importantly and least generically, there is a video game room! Which sounds very geeky, but bear with me. I’ve seen many big fancy houses with a “theater room”, with a big, flat screen (maybe even curved?!) TV, popcorn machine and some theater-style chairs even, with the walls lined with red velvety curtains or something. I’ve got something similar in mind, but more with video games, and there’s cabinets behind the curtains for space for games and consoles and such, and maybe even an additional TV that can be pulled out, in cases where the newer TVs won’t display older systems in flattering graphics. Maybe instead of a bunch of theater-style seats, there’d be some smaller comfy seats or couches nearer to the TV to make for easy gaming. Of course, it could ALSO be used for TV and movies, and some things could be switched out if necessary to make room for DVD players and such, but that’s not nearly as fun! The house is probably in a nice, green, kind-of-rainy-but-not-excessively place, with some trees around and maybe a nice river/stream nearby. I work in game design/programming, and make lots of money, then at the end of the day come home to see my spouse and my (possible) kids, maybe one or all of them are adopted. We eat dinner together as a family, and I take somewhat frequent vacations and breaks to spend time with them and go out and have fun and make memories and form ever-closer relationships. I also rarely have to cook, because A) my spouse can cook very well and enjoys doing so, and/or B) I (or combined with my spouse’s paycheck, if spouse works too) make enough money that we can eat out, or put minimal effort into meals since most of the meal is already made from store-bought materials. (But we eat a lot of pasta at home, frequently, and the fridge is consistently stocked with leftover noodles and Parmesan. Nice.) Our family has good, open communication, with little judgement and consistent efforts to be better people and kinder to each other. We are happy, and we love each other. Of course, this is the “dream” life, so much of it might come off as unrealistic. It’s pretty foofy-frilly dreamy idealistic life. Nonetheless, I’m more than happy to dream of, and more importantly, work towards, having a life like this. One day…

Look, guys. Everyone else is writing about making an impact, or finding a loved one, or do something actually important. I don’t want that. I just wanna grow up and get an average-ish job. Maybe one as a consultant in a small company, or a coder at some tech company. Not a lawyer, not a doctor, not some stupid time-consuming office job I don’t want. Maybe a 9–5 job, or maybe even a stay-at-home job. Breakfast? Nothing fancy. I don’t care about eating as much as my family does. Maybe some bread or a Chinese pastry, some fruit or veggies, and a hard-boiled egg. I’d bike to work, hopefully, or take a taxi. I don’t want to own a car. Lunch hour might just be a Chipotle, or maybe MOD pizza if I feel like eating unhealthily that day. Most of the time, it’d be a salad. I don’t really care…? At about six or seven, I’d get home. I want to live alone, or at least with a friend. No point in further explaining that. I don’t want to get married, or have kids. I want good friends, perhaps, but I want to live alone. Nothing too fancy, just a small apartment. I’d put on some music, switch to pajama’s. I want to live in a big city, though, a place where I can go out and party without driving. I would eat a stupid and cheap un-nutritional dinner (swiss cheese, an apple, bread, and some goddamn beer) and watch a TV show and unwind. Maybe hang out or get a simple dinner with some friends. If it’s a Friday night, I might as well get wasted. Electronics? I don’t want much. Fuck an “Amazon Alexa” or a large-screen TV, or whatever we’re coming up with then. All I need is a laptop and a decent phone that works with Summoners War and Discord. My current Laptop costed 250$, and I love it. Household furniture? Fuck that, I don’t care how pretty my chair looks. Get me a cheap-ass used sofa with a bit of bounciness and a used desk from eBay and a few chairs for about 500$ in all (I just searched some up and added it up, the stuff I’d buy is literally 500$ in all). The things I’d spend money on? I want a pet bird. A Pacific Parrotlet, specifically. Their care is kinda expensive, but it’s honestly not that bad. Maybe one or two would be enough, and with the job hours I want, I’d be fine with taking care of them mentally. I want a Spotify Premium account and a Netflix subscription. Maybe Amazon Prime…? Not that sure on the last one. Point is, I don’t want a glorious life. I don’t need money, I don’t need fancy things. I need friends… and happiness. That’s all I want. And I have literally no idea whether the job I’m describing would be enough to support the lifestyle I’m looking at, and I don’t know whether this is realistic at all. But that’s all I want. Fin,Rose.

I have several dreams.. some realistic, some more unrealistic.. save humanity. I want to reconstruct society and do away with all the evilness and structures of evil that corrupt and make mankind evil. Make a scapegoat of humanity.. I see many things that do such.Completely seclude myself from social interaction and move to some mountain town on a lake… I do not care for our society, in its current way. And until it is rid away of, I thereof, want to escape and be nonexistent within it.. I want to be unleashed by the laws as much possibly as I can, to be away of people who are void of compassion.. I don’t want to get hurt by anyone else out of their own pain, ignorance and upbringing, and I don’t want to hurt others. I don’t want to be told what to do… Nor do I, to hear of all the tragedy of the world when I have my own turmoil, trauma and pain.. I do not care to attach to things that need not be attached to.. I wouldn’t want to engage with anyone… For work, is just want to run a business from home and then use my writings as spruce of income, but in my society, I reconstructed how money is currently handled and do away with its current form, because it is one of the evil corrupters of mankind, that negatively manipulates the innate evil within every human.. Lust, greed, unauthenticity, jealousy, crime, illness, stress, competition, doing bad pit of need to survive, as you cannot survive without money.. Though some form of currency is necessary, for if we didn’t have it, it’d also create greed and competition and others wouldn’t know what’s theirs and who gets what.. I’d want a horse… I would want no neighbors near me, and I’d want to build a fence mountainlions couldn’t get in.Write and publish creative work and songs.. I wrote many poems when I was younger a a few songs and once I regain enough energy, I’d like to pursue more of this..Have one person that I’m very attached to and have them forever live with me in my lake mountain mansion in a fantasy.. I need only one person. Though I’d be horrified of losing this person… It doesn’t even have to be romantic.. I would hope we would be so attached, that if were one of us to die, we’d be able to communicate with one another astrally, and through signs.. Maybe even physically see their spirit, and since living a life uncorrupt of influence that distorts clairvoyance, it’s possible it would happen..Find some way to forever preserve youth and childhood, and make earth a sanctuary that is heavenly itself … Growing up and losing innocence is one of the most corruptive and evil of things..

I wake up go for a walk in the forest hear a low flying plane notice that it is being chased by another low flying plane I see it crash down I start running towards it but before I get there a larger black bag is in my path. I almost stumbled over it. I set it aside, and keep running towards the single engine sesna. Omg it’s a fully engulfed in flames. This is terrible but I hear a fire engine. I run back to the path i hear helicopters. What’s in that bag? I pick it up it’s heavy. Feels like a person but before the forest is covered with people I’ll just get it out of here. I make it back to my apartment and it feels like it’s fifty pounds of cast iron skillets. What’s in here the bag is locked? Why can’t I just rip the fabric? I guess I’ll wait til a little later. I’m going to Lowe’s to buy a tool or something to open this lock. I think it’s a bag of hammers or maybe some part to the plane that comes in squares. Ah who cares I’ll just go to Mc Donald’s and get some French fries. Maybe a diet Sunkist and cone of ice cream. Today is a fantastic day I feel great. Looks like the plane crash made the news. Wow two bankers robbed the federal reserve and tried to get away with 50 million dollars. Huh weird I’m gonna drink this orange Sunkist and dip my fries in ketchup. Then a smile hits me slowly just like the one you see on people who are truly happy. There are no words I start crying and smiling and I feel like spinning around!! I start spinning around crying out loud. It’s not true this is just a bag of airplane parts. I’ve got a chance now. Buying a passport buying my sister her house she always wanted laying low not making any big changes. Omg but tomorrow I can afford the filet of fish!! I can afford to help everyone I have ever met. I can put envelopes of money in every homeless persons hands I can afford to bury the poor. I’m going to start a farm because it’s been my dream to always have a farm. Too bad I didn’t give the money back but I noticed a couple days after the federal reserve was robbed a war was started so it will be quickly forgotten. I can’t wait to see the look on my sisters face when she opens he envelope that says she owns her property. She can keep her retirement all to herself.

Well, for me, I have a lot of dreams and things I want to achieve in my life. But these are my main dreams that I want to achieve in my lifetime: Travel the world   I never thought of traveling to every country in the world. But I do hope I can travel to every country that I love, such as the US, Canada, England, Spain, Morocco, Egypt, Italy, France, Germany, China, South Korea, Japan, Russia, Vietnam, Philippines, South Africa, Brazil, Argentina, Peru, Ecuador, Mexico, Chile, Australia, New Zealand, Fiji, and many other countries out there. I want to try new things in life. I want to step out of my comfort zone and start adventuring to different places I’ve never seen before. Yes, I know I’ve seen pictures of those countries on the internet, but here’s the question “Does that mean I have experienced everything just my looking at the picture?” Well, of course not. And that’s why I want to see and experience it myself, not only through my device, but in-person. Traveling is something almost everybody in this world loves, including me. I want to admit one thing though, I never traveled overseas yet in my life. I have travel envy whenever I see people traveling and doing fun things, but does that mean I envy them, like in a negative way? Of course not! They may have made me jealous, but they also made me want to be just like them once I grow up. Traveling can be a great memory for you and other people to remember. Not temporarily, but a lifetime! So I’m going to give it my all so I can travel the world and make this dream of mine come true. Become successful in life I don’t want to be a millionaire or a billionaire. That’s not my main point. I never thought of become an entrepreneur and be successful like Bill Gates, Steve Jobs, Elon Musk, Larry Page, Sergey Brin, Mark Zuckerberg, or any of them, no. I just want to become successful, as in having a stable job with good enough salary, have a loving family who can care and understand me well, and be productive at spending my day. Everybody has their own definition of success. And this is my definition of it. Although I might have said I don’t want to be a millionaire or billionaire, that doesn’t mean I never want to achieve that. I would be glad if I can, but that’s not my main point when I say I want to become successful in life. Be the best version of myself I don’t want to compare myself to others. I don’t want to be insecure about myself. I just want to be myself, and be the best version of myself that I can be. That’s what I truly want in myself. I know a lot of people who always compare themselves to others, and although this can be good at times (I’ll admit, I also do that sometimes), there are those who does it negatively and they ended up feeling insecure about themselves that they hate themselves and never think they’re worth it. That’s negative, and should be avoided at all costs. Instead, compare yourself to others in a good and positive way that can benefit both you and the person you’re comparing yourself with. Never fill your mind with negative things. Instead, do the opposite and just be yourself. Be the best version of yourself that you really want!

Always on a coastline with the water always to my left. Strange unknown structures and buildings that somehow feel familiar but then again don't to my right. Quite often a feeling of working on a ship or some other floatation device fixing up or rectifying or creating something I don't understand. All Is Strange but I don't feel lost I know I belong here. This is the general set out for a dream I have quite regularly. I really have no knowledge of where I am but I just know that it's where I'm supposed to be. I always advance up the coastline with the water always to my left I never turn in land or back just a relentless push forward. I don't know where it leads but I'm bound to follow. Sometimes these dreams have dangerous overtones and have involved fighting and other forms of combat. Which strangely for a Dream I actually feel pain. This sometimes wakes me other times it doesn't. I don't know if it's ordinary to feel pain in a dream but I'm not unique so it happens to me therefore others must cop it. I used to get lucid dreams quite often. I curse myself now for not taking advantage of them to learn more about the Dreamworld .instead I treated them like I treat everything, just another adventure to have fun with and then move on. Sometimes I wake up from the Coast Line dream feeling satisfied I'd learnt something. Others it was fearful because I had not achieved a particular task. On other occasions I have woken to have a complete recollection of a dream in total. I lay there in the dark going through the memory searching, searching for clues and sometimes finding a gem that sits in the jigsaw. But never ever have I had any clue as to where I am or what I am. I just am, no thoughts of evil, or goodness. Sometimes these dreams can run like a television episode in sequence. One nightmare I had and it was the greatest granddaddy of nightmares. Ran over the course of four nights it was a dreadful dream it just picked up from the night before. I was in a deserted farmhouse way Off The Beaten Track. I can't recall who my companions were but I think one was a girl and one a bloke that's my age. The protagonists the things of Nightmare arrived at this deserted farmhouse in 1960s models Mini Minors. 4 of them each carrying 4 people. At first all seems well they looked a bit dodgy, but trust me anyone in this part of the world looks dodgy because they generally have some warped ideas going on. Anyway as the dream progressed the people began to look less dodgy and more downright dangerous. Strange secretive unnerving. Different somehow. That was the note the first episode ended on unsettling, but not horrifying. Night 2 begin on a bad note one of these visitors had found a recently buried dog and was munching it with gusto. Much to the disgust of me and my two companions. Once in the course of his eating one of his fellow travelers yelled at him “why are you eating that bloody dog .You never going to get anything from it. Piss off said our dog muncher and got on with his maniacal nibbling. Somehow one of them got me cornered in a laundry or an outhouse. Told me they could only survive by eating the flesh of the still living. We 3 were the coming banquet for tomorrow's late tea. Dream ended there on that somewhat dramatic note. When I awoke I was physically and mentally not in a very good state in fact I was saturated with sweat it was dripping off me. Night 3 . You've got to bear in mind that this dream even in it's episodic way was completely real to me ,as realistic as the red dust that makes up the outback. Dream resumes from where it left off. He was holding a large rusty carving knife while telling me this was what he was going to cut me up with. it had yellow paint stain on the handle and part way down the blade. Human Nature took over ,he was holding a blade at me, I pulled a flick knife on him a good size stiletto sharp enough to shave with. Acting upon a longtime Mantra of he who hesitates dies. I plunged the knife deeply into the left side of his chest as was possible. Nothing happened he made no sound no bleeding and no Falling To The Ground just stood there with his blade in his hand looking at me with deep dark eyes I hadn't noticed earlier. Then he raised his blade to have a go at me it was in that moment I realised that he was already dead and so were his 15 companions. Wakefulness brought me back to Sanity sweating like it was going out of fashion. Nightfall arrived it was nearly Dreamtime again. In spite of the previous 3 episodes rattling my chain somewhat .I had to know how the dream was going to end if indeed it was going to end tonight. My companions and I determined that mere knives or axes. Weren't going to cut it so to speak. But we had found a store of old gasoline. We split it into 4 five gallon containers. And did what the witch hunters did. Splashed them with enough fuel and then we lit them up. The screaming was intolerable it was more a screeching howling wind filled with terror than a scream. The creatures aimlessly scrambling around the farmyard. screaming in Fury that their misappropriated lives were being removed from them. Then we found a vehicle that worked and headed for the highway. who knows to find another hell. it was after all only a dream and our dreams don't hurt us do they ? This is a really cut down version of that dream it's reality and it's intensity still Jar me today quite a few years after having it. I hope that having now recounted it I don't have to re dream it.

Probably the question for me is what are your “ambitions”. Let just start from beginning. When I was 5 years old my father went outside the city for an audit and he bought me a doctor set from there and while playing with it I decided that I want to be a doctor . At the age of 10 I went for a trip by air and boarded the plane for the first time. Then I decided I wanted to be a pilot. At the age of 14 I wrote an essay on where there is a will there's a way. It got a lot of appreciation from teachers that day I decided that I wanted to be a writer. At the age of 15 I represented my school in a zonal level dance competition and was qualified for the state level. Dancer was a good choice then. At the age of 16 I gave a speech in school assembly. And my ambition was changed to becoming an anchor or a speaker. At the age of 22 years I ended up being an inorganic chemist. These things still make me laugh. What I am today is very much different from what all I wanted to be. But still I am happy because I have worked Hard to earn it. The ambition which I have now(more sensible one) and would work hard for them I want to be known as an independent woman. The woman who is not dependant on anybody for her needs To make my parents proud. I want my parents to be known by my name To provide love and care to all those children who are deprived of it. If we are born in a good family we have previlages why can't we use them to help others. Those children definitely need them. To take care of my parents. BEing a daughter I want my parents to stay with me. I want to take care of them the way they did it for me. To cherish each and everything life has given me and to work harder for things I want.

I’m very grandiose when it comes dreams of the future. My first and foremost dream is to be the greatest person that has ever lived. Now that dream is a collection of a bunch of other dreams. In my first stage, I want to become the best music artist of all time. I want to revolitionize the music industry, not so much the industry, but the music itself, I want to evolve it and bring the future to us in terms of sound and communication. I want to become a recognized global music icon and gain respect similar to the likes of Michael Jackson, 2pac and Elvis. That’s only stage one. Stage one is there to provide me with the power and influence to do bigger things. With stage one finished I should have a good base to acomplish other things. One is to bring the future of fashion to us. Create my own design brand and create wild concepts of the future including fashion cybernetics and technology. I want to invest in technological research and advancement in the field of teleportation, and hopefully make groundbreaking achievement. I want to make movies or perhaps some other form of storytelling that will be far more dated. I want to research this field. I want to perhaps write a book about my experiences with life when I’m older. These are some of the points I know I will get into after stage one. Stage one is my primary focus as of now. I have a deadline to finish it before 30, otherwise it will be harder for me to do all the other things. Let’s get to work!

Do I have ‘A’ dream…? Oh yes I do…I have many.. Yes..I have a dream Biology Career.. I have a Dream to make my parents happy.. But besides all of these..I have but one dream. .which might sound impossible ..But I'm gonna work hard to make it come true however hard it might be.. It's really simple actually.. Currently I'm saving money.. Money that my parents lend me for doing something good..or whatever.. Not for myself… But for the needy.. I have a wish..A dream..to cook fresh food..buy new clothes..at least give my clothes..distribute my books among those who need it..to those people lyingon the pavements..living there. .Educate every child whose future is being destroyed because of child labour..and try to support their families.. But all of this can't be done by me alone..others should cooperate.. And yes..Most of us do have this same dream.. And yes..many people have been doing such activities across the world too.. My wish is that I could do it too...and..I know I can..I'm thinking about it..in a national level..more than that..A global level.. Oh yes..many people have already started with this..and many people are striving to take it to a global level..but my dream is that it comes true very soon.. But…   This is what's happening now.. Who's with me? Honestly.. I got shouted at by my grandad last week for lending money to a handicapt in a temple. .:(

I find eating some cheese just before heading off to bed, is the best way [for me] to remember what I did dream. And some of them are movie-length, but without a satisfactory ending, poorly scripted and directed, LOL. And, of course, NO credits or subtitles. Or even music, I have to do something about that [mental note, music to accompany my dreams from now on]. I’ve had dreams, after watching any movie, of being IN that movie, including horror/comedy/sci-fi movies. I had a dream, about “going postal” screaming at everyone I worked with, and complete with the generic staring from people, as in their own WTF expressions - that look, that “he’s never done this before” look. And maybe in the dream, they were worried I was going to be violent or something, but I didn’t physically harm them just ranted like a mad man, like something had really [swearword] me off.  When I woke up, I honestly thought I was going to get fired for being like that, LOL. I thought it had happened, and someone was going to ring me and say something like “we have to talk about your being angry the other day, and why we decided to let you go, and I would like to suggest anger management therapy at the very least, before you consider a job anywhere. What you did, is just not acceptable, and some of us are wondering why it happened? Are you okay?” I had another different dream of somehow getting the local train, with Clint Eastwood on board - as you do. Like that would happen where I live, maybe he was doing a movie in the area? Probably not, but hey it was a dream. I had a dream where EACH carriage of the train, was the size of a room in the Post Office, LOL. And for some strange reason, I was attempting to move from carriage to carriage, without being soaked by some brown glue and trying to get past several boxes of envelopes and letters etc. And I have never worked for any Post Office in that capacity, including mail room. Most of my best or weirdest dreams have NEVER reflected actual life or situations involving work, at all. Movies, sure, but never day to day stuff.

I want to live in an isolated lighthouse. And this is currently my main lighthouse of choice:  The place has a troubled history, however, as explained in this article written by Christy Heather from listverse.com: “Tevennec Lighthouse is a tiny structure that sits in isolation off the coast of Brittany, France. It has a long association with horror. Folklore tells that it was a repository for the corpses of the local dead and that it was inhabited by Ankou, the personification of Death itself. The lighthouse was constructed in 1875, and the first keeper succumbed to mental illness, hearing voices telling him to leave. As a result, running this isolated lighthouse became a two-man job and no one was to be there for more than a year. After the deaths of a two-man team, it was decided that men could take their wives. Still, some men on duty died unexpectedly and others killed themselves. No matter what was tried, even exorcisms, nothing seemed to help. After the partial destruction of the dwelling in a storm (while a keeper’s wife was giving birth, to add to the drama), the lighthouse was fully automated in 1910. There have been plans to turn the island into an artist’s retreat, but this has not been successful so far. Maybe Ankou doesn’t want paint everywhere.” Me again. I don’t care about any of that. What a dream home!

I take it I can spend as much as id like? My dream house would be a standing on top of a cliff overlooking the sea. The house would be white and in the style of Art Deco/Modernist, rather Like Frank Lloyd Wrights Fallingwater. It's gardens would shrubs and trees, growing slightly wild, with a waterfall tumbling down to the sea. Downstairs the floors would be reinforced black mirrored glass, with fitted bookcase of reinforced glass. Walls whiter than white, used in art galleries. With chrome deco picture lights over each painting, consisting of Picasso and Braque cubist period. Mattisse cut outs, Piet Mondrians ’Theory of Plasticism. two small sculptors by Barbera Hepworth and Henry It's living area would be furnished with Marcel Breuer’s Wassily chairs and LeCorbusier chairs and long sofa. No curtains, fitted wood slat blinds. Stair carpet and rugs I’d design in deco and Bauhaus designs. Although it’s pre Art Deco, I’d quite like one bedroom to be completed in the Mackintosh style. A 1988 Porsche 911 in the garage would finish it off nicely. How would I draw all this, for the exterior and ground plan I’d use grid paper, the interior designs would be drawn free hand, perhaps using gouache or coloured inks. Probably not very professional, but I’d feel comfortable doing that way.

When I was 8 years old, it was dream to go to space. I remember vividly how I imagined it You went into the spaceship as your saying goodbye to your family. The spaceship blasts off, puffing smoke onto the ground and the pressure pushes you back into your seat and your eyes tear. After minutes you unbuckle your seat belt and gently float around alone in your ship, peacefully admiring the lack of gravity. After an hour or so you reach the atmosphere of the moon. You get on your heavy spacesuit and get on the teather. As you step out the door, the gravity lifts you up as you gently push off floating Away like a free balloon. I helplessly continue forward as I look to the stars. I face the beautiful moon that I talked to down on earth. I admire her beauty. I’m pulled back from the teather, get back in, and land. I float down as I hop of the ship. I “feel” the moons solid state of material. I place some in a plastic bag to actually feel later. I can could still feel the presence of the moons power. My footprints stain the the moon. And I walk toward the American flag placed there to put a rainbow flag next to it(I actually didn’t know I was bisexual during this time so I just wanted a rainbow flag😂) Sorry for the long answer 💕✨

This is first time I am sharing my dreams on Quora. Because it is way too far out of my reach. So you can say it daydream. But this is what I think of when I am sleeping, waking up or relaxing… Every day, every night. Please don't judge me without reading whole answer.  1st priority of my life is to serve. Society, Nation, humanity. I am doctor. Want to be a neurosurgeon. Why? Because Neurosurgery is associated with highest mortality (death) and morbidity (disease affecting life!) I want to do some research and want to have some positive impact.Neurosurgeon is the best person who can adress trauma and most likely to create difference in life of someone in emergency.In all fields of medicine, Neurosurgeon is one of the hardest working doctor and also doing one of the toughest jobs! As byproduct Neurosurgery will give me huge amount of money. Let me tell you, I don't have any special needs. I can live and travel without AC. Can sleep on floor, can eat any food which is Jain and healthy. I never buy anything for brands. When I will have very good amount of money, may be my expenses will rise but not in priority. 1st thing I want to do is to give my parents some better quality of life. Because they have just brought everything expensive for us (me & my sis) and themselves lived a simple life! So I know a few things they would like to use even if they refuse now. But they are very very simple so that I can do it in residenship too. But my real story of dreams start now.  I want to buy something like this. An ambulance, want to load it with some medicines, and go to remote villages. So I will spend some of my holidays in free medical camps and serve poor people who can't even come to hospitals in city.  This is my dream since last 3–4 years! Because even as a medical student, I was habitual of going to camps due to some great doctors around who used to donate for same!  I want to make a system in hospital where in emergency no money is taken in advance and atleast for children money should not be reason of refusal of surgeries. It's a huge thing, because in surgeries, share of income of doctor is just 10-15-20%. So in case if someone can't pay anything, it needs a huge huge donation apart from a surgeon's big heart who can operate for free.  Still in 2019, in India there are lakhs of children who can't go to school. I just hope, I can help a few number of children to go to school by providing some financial support! Even there are some retired teachers and volunteers who can teach those children but lacks environment, trust and security. There are many plans related to that. Because I have visited huge amount of those people and know their actual problems. I have lived for few days in small peripheral villages for medical camps. Or regular visit in urban slums of my city.  I want to start permanent helpline for suicide prevention. In India, most common cause of death in youngsters is Suicide. Hundreds of potential good lives lost in India just because of lack of some support, communication and preventable/avoidable reasons. Happy to say till now I have counseled around 300–350 people for same and most if then are traceable and successful today. But this is very very small number for me. I want to reach when I can't even estimate number.  I want to work for adolescents in helping them taking right decisions. Because at most crucial stage of life, when decisions on career and relationship can change whole life from upside down, very very few luckiest guys get proper guidence on what is right vs wrong. In career, I can bet, more than 95% students in my country choose career without any interest and that's why living unhappy unsatisfied life!!!  I want to engage myself in research activities. I want to publish my articles in reputed journals. I want to go and present my work in big international conferences. I want to keep learning for whole of my life.  I am very much passionate about teaching. Even as an intern, I love to teach complex medical concepts in very simple words to my juniors. So I want to take some lectures just for fun and to provide some help to medico friends.  Few personal dreams which are not so high on priority. I hope I live with my family always. And as of now, I always have most happy family with beautiful relations and strongest bonds. And few good friends!I want to write a book. I hope I can write atleast one before I die.I want to travel world. Explore new places, cultures , meeting new people. (I said travel - not only tour). As an overview, I want to stay alive. I want to stay humble & kind. I want to stay curious, childish and foolish as I am now! Even if I can't do big things or change so many things, I want to die with satisfaction that I always gave more than I got. I want to live my life like I can smile at my last moment and say proudly, I lived my life in a way I wanted.

“Dream is not the thing you see in sleep but is that thing that doesn't let you sleep”-To quote Dr.A.P.J Abdul Kalam. And the thing that doesn't let me sleep is the fascinating night sky! This vast expanse of observable universe that stretches infinitely holding billions of galaxies and black holes that are million times the size we could ever imagine. We human beings are even smaller than a pin point as compared to the magnificent cosmos and space. I have a dream of going out beyond the horizons into the space , into the universe and explore things. I want to know about each and every bit , right from the beginning of universe to formation and existence of black holes and other galaxies . Movies like Interstellar, The Martin have greatly ignited my desires . I feel like knowing the secrets of the cosmos. Stephan Hawking's documentaries have satisfied me to a great extent but yet , there lies a part of me that is eager to digest the other unsolved mysteries. I want to see myself in the space suit,just like Mark Watney( dude ,he looked damn s3xy) and experience what Neil Armstrong felt while he set his left foot on the moon. How will it be to be on Mars and how is it like being near a black hole ( i wouldn't survive then, perhaps to share what it felt like, lol) I think this dream is a bit quixotic to be accomplished, but yes,it has stolen my sleep since years . Wish I could flaunt someday- Hurray! My dream came true!

If you had ask me this question some 20 years back, I would have myriad of answers. Age 5–6: I was very much fascinated by my class teacher that I wanted to be teacher only. The black Godrej almirahs is my testament of how badly I wanted to be a teacher that it has only chalk stains on it.Age 10–12: I got obsessed with the idea of being Miss India. Please don’t judge and please don’t laugh. It was a genuine dream. May be cause of too much TV or mesmerised by being all this glitter and glam.Age 13–14: Journalism may be?Age 18: Got into an engineering college (surprise surprise) with this aim that I will get a PhD degree and have a Dr. in-front of my name.Clearly all this never worked out cause right now I am working in a Central govt. autonomous sector and won’t say that I hate it but I don’t like it either. One thing I understood that life never works out they way we vision when we are young. May be we can direct or drive it to our goals but it doesn’t exactly turn out to be way we want it. So to answer what is my dream of life? I would say two things: I want to be a good person. No I mean it. Being a good person is difficult, especially in these times. Often we do or say things to our friends, family and relatives which at first may sound funny but after we realise what we actually meant. Good person doesn’t mean good marks or do well in life or always do good deeds. It also means to have a good, encouraging feeling towards life, be responsible and be cautious. How good of a person is not decided by how well you’re doing in life but it depends on how you treat your present. How true you’re to everyone and everything including YOU. So being a good person is something I dream to be.And I want to travel to these two places and that too solo. Auschwitz Camp  Fushimi Inari temple. I really want to go these two places and I would do anything to be there, to be present there and witness everything. For the Auschwitz camp, I am really intrigued, empathetic and very curious about the life of jews who were held in this particular concentration camp. And I have read books, seen documentaries which has invoked a grave interest for a very long time. About the temple, I don’t know, something about the red pillar entrance that draws me towards it and I just want to sit there, relax and soak in everything around me. May be write a travel journal, detailing what I saw and felt. I am really saving it up for these two travels. I hope I can successfully stick to my dreams and get to live it. May be write my experiences about it On Quora some day. One at a time.

Hi, I’m from Tamil Nadu (southern area). Currently, I’m working as an accountant in one private company. My salary is Rs. 6960 /- only per month. This salary is not enough for my live and daily expenses. I want to earn more above at least 15k. But my knowledge is not sufficient to touch that hike. My aim is nothing special to say. But I want to speak English very fluently. I would like to travel all over the world. If we want to travel, we must know English then only we can able to survive in other countries or states. So, I have tried many ways to speak. But it does not help me to speak fluently. When I try to speak, I’m trembling in front of all. So, I decided to go to a spoken English class. I was very excited to go. I had built a huge dream after I pay my joining fee in that institute. “Hereafter I will speak English I can take my seminar in English”. Lots of dreams I had in my mind before joining the class. On the first day of my class, I eagerly entering the class, but everyone was staring at me. (they all are children at the age of below 10) Their English teacher was absent for a while. So, they thought of me as a new teacher. I was humiliated. The children came and sat next to me and ask a question about English grammar. I cannot tell them that I didn’t come to teach u all. But then they have known that I’m not their teacher from the institute owner. After a two day, the teacher came, she looks beautiful. She speaks very politely to all students and said how much missed them all. Then she told me to introduce myself in English (she has already heard myself from the institute owner). I started to explain myself as she told. After heard all about me She said that you speak well. The birds were fled in my heart when I get compliments from her. The days were passing, she told me to follow one principle to speak English. That is, “Think English when you see an object or anything”. She has given homework to write down my own memories in English. I did all that she said. I have learned new English words and my pronunciation was changed little more. But my trembling never changed when I speak in English. When she started to chat with me in English, my mother tongue automatically comes by naturally. Then I left that spoken English class due to my poor economy. Still, I have trying to speak English. Even I left that English class, but I didn’t give up my aim. I have watched many English movies and k-dramas with subs, I can understand what the concept of movies is and points, jokes, etc..., But I won’t be able to speak English fluently till now. What I learned from trying to speak English, I need to learn and know newer English words, I should interact with well-known English speakers. When I was surfing on the internet, I came to know this website. From that day I addict this. So, I use Quora every day and started to follow many peoples and reading their stories to develop my English skills. Sorry for my poor English. I know it will be very hard for you to understand because of grammatical errors.

Currently, I am 22 and working full time in the corporate sector. My annual package is of 4.1 L and I get around 30K in hand. I am working as a process analyst under operations, not a specific field. I am the only earning person in my family. I do not hold any good degree, only Bcom graduated with minimal marks from open school. I do not have a specific interest in any field or any passion. Yes, I am concerned about my future and do not want to waste 12 hours of every day in a job. Also, I have a strong responsibility now and it scares me to switch anywhere. It restricts me to try or explore other things. My dreams for the rest of my life would be: I want my future to be as stable as water. Yes, I can from a struggling family but I do not wish to be rich. I have realized how the lower middle class and poor people waste their precious life in this race of struggle.I want my future to be free of time. I want to live fully with my family and teach them how to cherish this beautiful gift of life.The profession I want should be a less time consuming but enough to pay me around 2–3 lakhs monthly. I think it would be a middle scale in the next 10–12 years. The rest time I want to spend with my another half and later with my kids.I expect a love marriage with a relationship of at least more than 5 years. I really get inspired by seeing couples who stick long and get happily married till the eternal.I wish to get married until I find myself stable enough to add a new family member. Maybe around 30? What say?I want my partner to work, definitely not a 9–5 job. I want her to work anything weather it creates wealth or not. I do not want just a housewife. Again she should be free of her work whenever she wants to do.I expect at least 2 babies not matter its a girl or boy. But I also want both, it will give me a feeling of parenting two different genders. Who doesn't want that?I do not want my kids to be educated in a premium school even if I am capable of. I believe that parents wish so that their kids go not gets into bad company. I feel its very commons and there’s a age where things become different. It happens with every kid weather its a rich kid or poor. Studying in a govt school has different surround and a good school has different. You will find bad things everywhere. I want my kids to be wise that only parents can teach them not any school. It depends on their upbringing.I want my finances to be good enough to travel often around the country. Also, I could save enough to explore other countries with my family sometimes.These are my little dreams

My biggest goal and dream is start my own school. I am currently a senior in high school who is going into the study of architecture. throughout high school I have had the amazing opportunity to see many, many different learning styles. From Project Based Learning to Traditional, and weird blends of the two. The main point I have arrived at on my opinion of teaching is that the current system is broken, and we don’t know how to fix it. Fun Fact: Our education system was implemented in the 1920’s and was modeled after the blue-collar jobs at the time. Our education system hasn’t changed since 1920. Jobs have changed since 1920, and employers are looking for workers with critical thinking and problem solving, not workers who can be told “Turn this wheel when the material is beneath the press.” Traditional schools were not designed to make the person employers are now looking for. I realized this, and been designing an educational model that fully readies students to tackle their future and be adaptable to any situation, and be able to think critically on situations and problem solve based on their conclusion. My hope and dream is to design my own school and than teach my model in it. I am fearful of things blocking my path -money, age, potential laws, support-, but I know that my model would be best for the students, so I am going to do everything possible to achieve it anyways.  Keep Questioning! -Connor

I am working on starting up my own business online and joining multiple platforms to sell my designs, pictures and graphic design services. It is my life long goal and dream to be able to work at home earning a decent living doing what I love to do with the talent and gifts God has blessed me with. I am having a difficult time trying to get there though and sometimes I feel overwhelmed with so many other things that I will have to know and do that go along with it. That’s what is holding me up, because I have been having to do a lot of research and studying online to learn the things I don’t know. I want to make sure I try to get everything right or as close enough to it as I can so I will have a better chance at succeeding. It is taking me a lot longer than I would like and I end up getting frustrated and upset with myself that I have to walk away from it for a little while. It is also hard for me because I am a single mom trying to juggle everything else along with working a full time job. It sure doesn’t leave me much time left over to devote to dream. I also have a lot of problems trying to stay focused when I have adult ADHD/ADD. It is a challenge for sure but it is one dream and goal that I have never given up on. I am 53 right now and I feel like it is never too late to try to achieve your dreams. I may get there and I may not and I may be 80 years old before I do, but I sure know one thing and that is I will keep trying up until the day I die.

A nice question. Actually, I am at the fag end of my life to DREAM. Because, I just crossed my 60th birthday, for which, I have to RETIRE from my service. Though life will continue and there is NO retirement from life until death, but now the definition of 'dream' is different for me.................Actually "DREAM" is a volatile term. Yes, volatile. It changes its colour with time and with advancement of age. ...............The term "Dream" is never understood by the youth of current times. Now, current generation is such that the parents make all the decisions on behalf of the kid and the kid remains to be kid till he completed the education as designed/ thought by the parent / guardian. You can see that parents decide the future of the kid, even, what to wear, what to eat, where to stay, who are to be friends, which institution to choose to get education, which course to choose and even the placement in organisation and place to get employed all are being chosen by the parents. There is little scope for the kid (son/daughter) to think about own passion and own life till he is already an adult. this has made many youths frustrated after joining their jobs so selected/chosen....................................................................................................If you are born before 70's then you can find that the parents of those era had decision regarding the institutions and courses, if they had some consciousness on education system and if they had the financial resources to provide their kids, else, the kids themselves think and choose their path, looking into the support system from their parents. Naturally, all parents of those period, had the "dream" to see their kids in abetter position than themselves. But they had no knowledge, where to get such guidance. In those period, the 'village school master' was the path finder. For everything, he was the 'friend, philosopher and guide'. At that time, the unemployment problem was not so acute as of today. After completion of school courses, kids were getting opportunity to choose from the employers. Though, I completed B.Ed in 1979, I received messages from four to five high schools through persons, to be a headmaster of their schools. I had not applied. But to create formal record, I had to write one simple application to join the school, where I worked for about 18 months. In those days, I have just found the parents on admission days and to take the school leaving certificates for their kids admission in another schools. Else, the kids had to do all other needful jobs for himself, from paying monthly fees, attend school functions, sports, even appear the examinations themselves. But parents were getting periodical information through parent teacher meetings, which was never regular. It was sufficient to flash a notice to the students in the class was sufficient to get parents informed. The parents know the school and also teachers know the thinking of the parents in those times. The punishment in the school was NEVER thought in a guilt sense and the students also so obedient that punishments were rarely applied. The parents felt that physical punishment in schools were to amend the behaviour of their children only. The schools were not for business purpose at all.As the time passed, the population grew, the new parents became conscious of the education system and unemployment problems, which has now taken the shape of business in schools. OK. it is the affairs now................Regarding the DREAM, the kids are given a topic in classes to write on "Aim in Life" and the teacher guides them to write on a specified jobs like, a doctor, an engineer, Teacher and like. The students are never given an opportunity to think and write. The Parents have already designed the "Aim". Hence the boy or girl thinks about his or her dream when, he/she is already in the last rung of the ladder to select the job.And after that, there is little scope to design the so called dream.For me, .................................I was interested to be in education stream, first to be a research associate and then to be a professor in universities to guide the students for development of the society. But the passion developed late, as I was from a financially weaker family and I was not groomed to think for myself. It means, I was born and brought up in a strict social, financial environment by my parents. I had no opportunity to decide anything independently. I was always in the group of better students in the education life. Even if my decision were correct, those were proved to be wrong and naturally wrong decisions are always wrong. Only after graduation, I find myself in a fix, where I could not decide, how to proceed in life. .........................The strictness made me a rebel and I had to fled away from home for about two years and parents could not trace me. Then decided to undergo B.Ed training at Regional college of education, Bhubaneswar. During that training period, got information of banking job through "Banking Service recruitment Board". Applied. got selected in the first attempt for clerical job. Joined bank in 1980 December. But before joining bank, i had served as Headmaster for a Secondary school. ..................Only after joining bank, I dreamt to be a model banker. But once in a job, it is never easy to fulfill your so called dream easily..................But, I could achieve the following in my 36 years service in bank :...1. I was a clerk, Special Assistant, Officer, Manager in bank. (Clerk performs cashier job periodically)...2. I worked in a rural, semi-urban, Urban branch....3. I worked in all the sections/departments of a bank branch, like Deposits, Advances, Foreign Exchange, Bills, Clearing, MIS, and all the sections)...4. I worked in a branch, Administrative units like Regional office, Circle office, Head office....5. I worked in manual environment (physical Ledgers and Registers), ALPM, Networked through Novel, then through Linux environments, and lastly in CBS systems....6. I worked in general banking and then in Technology Department to migrate branches to CBS....7. I worked independently at an Institute to train unemployed youth for entrepreneurship under CSR activities of the bank (directly under Head Office) for 4 years as Director. I was in charge of selecting the trainees, trainers, food caterers, course content, and after training following up with trainees for their settlements in entrepreneurship activities...8. During the service period got a chance to be inaugurating manager of a branch and served for six months before transfer to other state, and also the Director involved for inauguration of the Institute in other state and remained for 4 years there....9. I was taking classes of my colleagues for their promotions also - as a hobby, as a freelancers. .......My dream was to be a model banker and could achieve many more than expectation, as you can find it here. ...Many more experiences gained, which can never be expressed in written manner. ...Now after retirement, hoped to be a guide to new entrepreneurs, and I am in that process. I had not developed a dream, in the childhood days, for which I can not reply any BIGGEST DREAM, which I had never seen.

Well life's biggest dream depend upon several factors like your age, current status, financial-social-emotional well being ...but in my view the biggest dream of all time will be to become the perfect person.Characteristics of a perfect person- 1. They never complain and don’t waste their time with moaning. They never wish to be other person. . They don’t have barriers in their mind.3. They are always excited for what they are doing.4. They don’t get bored. They find something to do even in boring moments. They hate showing off and pretending to enjoy. They enjoy realities.5. They are independent and don't feel guilty. They don’t punish themselves.6. They live in the present time and are not worried about the future.7. They are not afraid of unknowns and always search for new experiences. They love mysterious things.8. They are not ignorant and stupid.9. They don’t enforce their love to be loves. Free from expectations, their relationship is based on free choice and mutual respect.10. Their private corner is very important for them. Sometimes they really love to be alone with the self.11. They don’t fall in love several times. Usually they fall in love once and forever.12. They are restrict to choose the beloved. But they love heartily and sincerely. Their love to their beloved will never end.13. Their way in life is not judgmental. They also don’t care about others’ judgment and don’t need people’s admiration and sympathy. They don’t need to make all people satisfied. They always say what they want and are not scared to proclaim their ideas.14. They are honest, frank and straightforward. They live based on their wishes and ideas.15. They are not stubborn. But they choose their way by own.16. They ignore stupid traditions and irrelevant barriers.17. There is an account in the bank for them. But they don’t kill themselves to make it full of money. Money is the last thing they care for.18. Seriously and attentively, they’re wise, open-minded and practical.19. They know how to laugh and make laugh. They like to tease people. But their way is not because of enmity or hatred. They never ridicule others. They don’t laugh at people, but they laugh with them. People enjoy to be with them, because  they make joyful atmosphere around themselves.20. Routine life is not their way. They love variety.21. This life for them is a temporary time. Working hard to be better person, they never take life serious.22. They don't say sorry for what they really love to have.23. Facing the problems, They don’t get emotional and confused. They fight and win over problems. But they also don’t fight to take ineffectual and unfruitful goals. They are not essentially hero/heroine. Yet they are active and supportive.24. Life for them is not living on surface. They usually go for content and know how to live.25. They are creative and imaginative. For anything, They use their mind and their power of thinking. They are powerful, strong and full of energy.26. They need less sleep and they are healthy. There is no way for depression.27. They don’t put people in groups and don’t blame them.28. Thirsty to know, They love to learn more and more. They are very curious and are not afraid of failure. They are mostly learner instead of teacher.29. They have strong relationship with God. They love nature and the world.30. They accept what they are. They love themselves and try to be best. The most natural people, They are themselves and not anybody else.Source=http://shahrzaad.wordpress.com

I am living in a Spanish apartment by the beach. I wake up to the view of the beach every morning. I'm on holiday from truck driving, but I get passable income from one or two small businesses. It's a Sunday morning, as per the ritual I cook myself a delicious full English breakfast. Mostly everything I own is either in this apartment or my mothers house in England. I don't have much. I rent everywhere I go. I don't want to flush money into mortgages. If I ever get bored of my environment I can pack up and be out within a week. I'm toned with a bit of fat, tattooed. I can drive a car, forklift, truck, dumper driver and excavator. I might be engaged, if I have kids I'll settle down obviously. If not then there's no worry. I work my ass off in my 20′s through my 30′s if need be. Then I sit back and rest. Knowing that this smalltown council estate kid will never go hungry anymore.

I dream this for every underprivileged kid in my country. I want to have a school of my own, where they can come and study. Where they can change their lives and have those same opportunities which I was privileged to have. As far as following my dream is concerned I am trying my level best.I am working with an organization which goes to a village near my college to teach in a low income school. I am teaching there and trying to sort the things. I also plan to join the two year fellowship of TEACH FOR INDIA so that I can gain every experience needed to help those kids. Now,   Can you see that guy in back hoody? Ya, that's me in Manali.  I love to travel.  I dream to travel as much as I can. May be the whole world. I just want to experience the adventure and the feeling of "living in the moment". I want to meet new people. I want to make my each and everyday count. To be able to afford and construct on my own, a hole in the ground. Not a nasty, dirty, wet hole, filled with the ends of worms and an oozy smell, nor yet a dry, bare, sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or to eat: I mean a hobbit-hole, and that means comfort. This has been my dream ever since I first read the books of J.R.R. Tolkien. And watching the movies, for all their flaws, really supported this determination. I believe that if you have a focus in your life, it will become real if you work hard enough and believe in achieving it. Every time I smoke my churchwarden pipe, enjoying the various aromatic blends of my tobaccos, I find my mind wandering on how I would start such a project, given I had the money.  The upper part of the picture canonically depicts the layout of Bag End as shown in “The Atlas of Middle-Earth” by Karen Wynn Fonstad. I would imagine my own hole being much smaller, considering even with a potential family I wouldn't have a need of 18 rooms. I can perfectly imagine myself in 20 years, sitting in a rocking or armchair, a nice fire in the chimney keeping me warm during a cool winter night, my German shepherd lying on my feet and a large carpet, providing me with extra warmth, while I take a soothing puff of my favourite cherry tobacco and occasionally sip on a glass of Irish scotch (the best!) after a long day of work. Only I've never had a long day of work ;)

The difference between life as we know it as spiritual beings is not A thing that can be defined in terms of what we were born as, (I hate saying that as it implies that some are not qualified or “worthy” ,that there is some exclusivity in Love, which is total bull ) But No. Normal is gone, and good riddance Dreams, they that run things dream for us as we live these in real life, the nightmare aborted (your dream in guilt / fear would be attributed to what was drawn upon (as each draws from his store)which in man is generally just that, worry, fear and the dreams that come are conditional and our lives surely built that into the subconscious that will not express A classic happy ending without a price as those that do not give freely do not believe that they receive freely. My aspiration is to exercise my creativity, connect with other people and try new things. These are general aspirations. As far as what I want to do career-wise, I’m not so sure. I’ve considered lots of different things and still haven’t quite decided. My direction isn’t so set and that’s okay. Yet, that’s just about me. To discover your aspiration(s), you have to explore. The only way to find your aspiration is by trying new things. By doing this, you’ll figure out what you want to aspire to. So start trying different things. Things you never tried before. Join clubs at school. Take different classes. Write a story or write in a journal. If you haven’t done it before, try it. Even if it scares you. Find a particular industry interesting? Try getting an inside look by interning at a business in that industry. By exploring, you’ll find something that really excites you. And then, you may just have your aspiration(s). I’m sure you’ll discover your aspiration. Be sure not to worry about discovering it so quickly, there’s plenty of time. Just remain open-minded, keep trying new things and eventually you’ll discover it. And be sure to have fun in the process.

We had intense arguments,i cried.I dont cry that often but leaving football forever was hard to stomach it;because I knew what they meant when they said “ abhi padhlo…mbbs mein admission mil jaye tab khel lena” To be honest,i dont blame my parents for that because they forced me to do it coz it was good for me;and on my dream profession list,becoming a surgeon is second.I was also interested and good in this field,so no worries there.. But this made me realise that there are so many people who dreams of becoming a footballer but are not supported by their parents just because there is no “scope” in india. SO MY BIGGEST DREAM IS TO MAKE FOOTBALL AS POPULAR AS CRICKET IN INDIA. I dont know how i am going to do it..all i know is; everything starts from inspiration for eg~ kapil dev,sunil gavaskar,sachin tendulkar have inspired generations of people to take up cricket by achieving something someone only could dream of. They made us believe that a human being is capable of doing great things with hard work.. So in order to make football famous,first of all i need to make people interested in football and indian football team need to win something big or someone who was born and raised in india must make his name on the global level.Only that can make it possible. I am the captain of college football team..when i came in this college there were just two good players..we worked hard to make a team..the team consisted of players who had neved seen football in life.Somehow we manage to win our first trophy which was college’s first ever trophy in any sports. This brought more people in.The more the people who get in the team the more their friends come the watch the match Now im in last year of mbbs…there are over 6 good college football team..we held our intercollege football every year which wasnt done before..there are nearly over 70 new football fans who follow their favourite club in every match.we even keep screening for champions league matches.and a lot of peope show up..so yeah!thats how inspiration…now this 70 fans will grow up to be parents someday and might support their kids..every big thing starts small. Other thing i wish to do is build up football academies in the country..with foreign coaches. For all of these i need a lot of money..so im working hard to becoming a successful doctor… The popularity of isl and the under 17 fifa world cup has helped a lot;but we need more of these..

Once Ashoka the emperor was on a walk along the beach.There he saw a sage who was sleeping at the shore. He was puzzled and ordered his men to get the sage to him. As instructed , ashoka’s men woke the sage up and got him to Ashoka. He was not pleased by seeing the sage wailing away his time sleeping, so he asked him weather he had no ther work to do. To this, the sage smiled and said, my emperor, what is that you want in life. Ashoka said that he wanted to conquer and rule the world the sage asked, and then? ashoka said that he would be very powerful and could do anything and everything.the sage smiled and repeated his qs, and then,?Ashoka then said that and ill have all the money in the world.H would then lead a peaceful life and sleep without worries and stay happy. I had two aspirations when I was young. I either wanted to be a teacher or a veterinarian. I started volunteering at a veterinarian hospital to see what it was like. A few months into it, they asked me to help while the vet neutered a cat. I was just supposed to hold the leg up and out of the way during the short procedure. I fainted dead away. One minute I was standing there holding the leg and the next thing I knew, I was on the floor and the vet was yelling at me to let go of the cat. I was still holding onto the leg. It was the only time I ever fainted in my life. After that, I figured that being a vet, or anything in the medical field for animals or humans, was probably not for me. I then started volunteering and eventually working in day cares and schools. I found that I was good at that and I have now been a teacher for over 15 years. The best way to find your aspiration is to get out there and try things. Volunteer at different things. Get some different jobs. When you are doing them, you will learn what you like and what you don’t.

We all have many dreams as kids, we see firefighters or ballerinas, and think, “that’s what I’m going to be.” But as we grow older we realize these dreams, well, they’re just that. Dreams. I had a dream to be the first person in my family to graduate high school, but I did not succeed, yet I persist. Now I’m aiming for my GED. My point here is that, even if you don’t get exactly to where you want, you can always get close if you try hard enough. My dream for the past seven years has been to become a published author. In this time, I’ve been creating a universe. I’ve got dozens of books planned out, I just need to start writing them, which is the hardest part. This is my dream, and it will not be easy. But, in the end, it might not be out of reach.

I don’t have any dreams. A “dream” is defined as “a cherished aspiration, ambition, or ideal.” I don’t have any of those. The only thing I have ever really wanted is to be wealthy enough to live a life of leisure and not need to work. Even as a child the question “what do you want to do when you grow up?” made me uncomfortable because my answer was always “nothing.” There is nothing I want to do, nothing I want to achieve, I have no particular ambitions or purpose in life. I kind of wish I did. But I have simply never found anything that interested me enough. Sure, there are things I don’t like about the world that I would like to see changed, but I have exactly zero interest in being the one to change them. I am happy just to watch. In fact, I don’t like doing at all. I’ve been doing all my life and none of it has ever brought me the slightest bit of happiness or satisfaction. I’m tired of doing. Frankly most things just aren’t worth it. It seems like you always put in more than you get back. I’m ready to be done.

Ambition is a big word....Still for some it exists and for some it doesn't....It has one particular meaning in the dictionary but has as many meanings as many there are people on the face of the Earth....Ambitions are in the real sense decided at a very young age... When you are so small in age for the world that they don't bother to influence you, they let you be, they set your mind free, unchained from their regular dilemma of society... You mind is under no pressure hence you explore inside yourself ( real place to find your true ambition) listen to your heart, become unbiased and talk to yourself and decide to do what appeals to your heart the most, something that makes you genuinely happy from within and not superficially and not the society...Then comes a time when parents start talking to you, telling you ( imposing) their experiences and narrating stories that only they have heard or seen.. Then you meet you relatives who give you more download about this "cruel" & " competitive" world and what ambition you should have to survive in it...Then you make friends, who tell you what ambitions they have based on the influence their parents & relatives have on them... Then you grow up a little more and attend school... Where the teachers have more success stories, they teach you about all the successful icons and leader... They forget to mention the real reason behind the success of those icons is cause they followed their heart and did what appealed to them... And then we write big essays about them in exams and score big marks get a big job and follow instructions that others give us, then marry the person others tell us, put our children in schools that others tell us... Where the hell is Ambition other than in the dictionary and on papers.... It should be yours hence from your heart what you truly love and that appeals to your unbiased and uninfluenced mind...

Ambition is all about what we excel for and try to get out best. This eventually sets silently at the end of our life, a state at which we say, we're settled. My ambition when I was around 15 was to become a doctor, later it fluctuated to UPSC and now Law. More or less, any ambition that we set off needs acute amount of passion, determination and dedication to perform, we're needed to remain disciplined and dexterous throughout our journey. Sometimes, ambition becomes a thorough process where constant work and passion is required,a belief that we can do with our potential, a standard of not compromising our worth for anything or everything around us. The taste of being ambitious is the card of life. We may change our ambition with learning, experience and taste but at the end of the day all we want is a deep sense of satisfaction at our day's work, how much we actually utilise the 24 hours we had in our hand. Though my ambition kept on changing but my only goal in life is to realise a state of blissfulness where nothing except the self matters, where love becomes the only thread of communication to my heart, where I say I'm satisfied and satiated with myself, along myself, where nothing materialistic affect me, where I realize what actually truth means, all I want is to spiritualize myself to my self with the most vibrant and inert delights I've. Yours, Vishal Kumar.

To live the van life. Apparently it’s all the rage. Millennials who can work remotely are supposedly finding all kinds of way to fund a lifestyle of nomadic travel. Critics say it’s just a way for corporations to get away from the responsibility of offering employee benefits. Regardless, if I had my druthers, I’d get one of the new outfitted camper trailers, complete with wi-fi and multimedia production capabilities. I’d travel around the country writing albums, writing travel books, and conducting interviews for podcasts. Something like Blue Highways but with multimedia production capabilities. It would be a helluva experience. And it’s my dream.

I realize this is a question-and-answer platform, but I’m a little hesitant to answer this one. The reason is say that is I’m wondering if by asking that question, you’re looking for ideas that you could adopt as a dream, without thinking about what it is YOU really want. Perhaps I’m wrong, but if you are unsure about your own dream, seeing others’ ideas is only going to make you feel more overwhelmed at all the possibilities. Rather, I’d suggest taking some time to journal on what you want your life to like in every area: who do you want to spend time with?where do you want to live?how do you want to spend your time?how do you want to feel?etc.Remember, you don’t need permission to dream big. Have fun with it and then start taking small steps to making it happen.

My fantasy is to go live in a lighthouse on the coast of Newfoundland. During the day I’d take long walks along the water on the grassy hills and look out as far as my eyes can see. I’d sit and listen to crashing waves. In the afternoons, wrapped in a soft blanket, I’d write and sip tea. I have a friend who has been to Newfoundland. My fantasy perplexes him. He knows I like warm weather and assures me Newfoundland is too windy and cold for warm-weather creatures like me. He points out that living in a lighthouse would always be drafty and adds that I don’t really drink tea. I have so very many fantasies that can never be. Tell me. Are fantasies supposed to be practical? Are they supposed to be plausible? Do I need to expend effort to make them come true? Would that not limit something meant to be unhinged, delusional, extravagant, unrestrained?

Most of the sleepy time I do not dream. If there is something I do not remember it. Every once of a while, I have a lucid dream—in which the quality and description is at a peak of detail. I do not assert my will; it’s not what my subconscious wants…in general I dream about a landscape and for my entire life I try to connect landscapes landmarks and interiors. I recall at a point when I needed true humility and I found myself standing in a great room, a big spacious layout where there were cluttered statues and historical artifacts of war and coats of armor and of mail. And in the center of it all, a raised platform with a toilet stall, under a dome.

I enjoy taking photos, and creating paintings from them. I became fascinated by an old 1930s paper mill that was crumbling away. I knew it was just a matter of time before it was razed to the ground to make way for something else. I knew I would be kicking myself if my procrastination kept me from it . I hung on to the black and white photos, not sure what I would do with them. Only knew that I just had to have them. I came across an old wooden sash 6 pane window with white paint chipping off. Painted and repainted over the years so many times. I chose 6 photos t0 draw and paint in water soluble graphite. I have three of the six sketched out. My goal is to use the individual panned openings , instead of conventional frames. to uniquely frame out the completed paintings.
